etymology.description: 精 + 制 + 品 = finely processed/made products.
etymology.interpretation: Combines 精制 “to refine; finely process” with 品 “product/item,” referring to goods produced with high purity or meticulous processing. Common in contexts like food, chemicals, and materials to signal higher quality or degree of refinement.
etymology.simplification: 製 → 制 by dropping the 衣/衤 ‘clothing’ component to reduce strokes and generalize the ‘make/manufacture’ meaning; 精 and 品 unchanged.

examples.chinese: 这种油是精制品(這種油是精製品)，杂质很少(雜質很少)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng yóu shì jīngzhìpǐn, zázhì hěn shǎo.
examples.english: This type of oil is a refined product, with very few impurities.

examples.chinese: 该公司把原料深加工成精制品(該公司把原料深加工成精製品)，销往海外(銷往海外)。
examples.pinyin: Gāi gōngsī bǎ yuánliào shēn jiāgōng chéng jīngzhìpǐn, xiāo wǎng hǎiwài.
examples.english: The company further processes raw materials into refined products and sells them overseas.

examples.chinese: 厂家声明精制品不含添加剂(廠家聲明精製品不含添加劑)。
examples.pinyin: Chǎngjiā shēngmíng jīngzhìpǐn bù hán tiānjiājì.
examples.english: The manufacturer states that the refined products contain no additives.
